text: I am papertrading my first strategy implemented in flumine, and I occasionally have latency issues. My strategy is really a straight (football) value betting strategy that will just take a backprice if it is +EV according to my model and lay when it is -EV. Dead simple with no need for precise timing, since the model operates on a timescale of minutes. With such a strategy is latency even something to worry about? To me it seems obvious that it is not, but being a noob and all, I’m a little scared I might be missing something in my reasoning. Apologies for the vagueness of the question!

text: The fact that you have latency issues is odd. Are you running on a machine in a data centre? Or is it because you're doing some heavy computation so it becomes a bottleneck? Probably best to solve those issues

elements.text: The fact that you have latency issues is odd. Are you running on a machine in a data centre? Or is it because you're doing some heavy computation so it becomes a bottleneck? Probably best to solve those issues

text: (FWIW I run a very similarly structured strategy on football and just execute over the REST API, no flumine there altogether)

elements.text: (FWIW I run a very similarly structured strategy on football and just execute over the REST API, no flumine there altogether)

text: Currently running it on my MacBook Air m1. I wouldn’t say I do heavy computation. The computation is done asynchronously in a different process, and the Flumine process reads the predictions from files(could switch to redis?), and does very little except for some simple bookkeeping. I do have some custom middleware for keeping track of  price movements that I might want to optimize, though. I’ve noticed that the warnings occur quite frequently right after starting Flumine, but then seem to disappear after a time. The reason why I want to use flumine is because I plan to add some HFT element to improve the prices I am getting in the future. Anyway, if you recommend that I eliminate latency issues whatever the cause, I will get to work straight away! Thanks for the input :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Should be fairly straightforward to eliminate the latency warnings, it's not something I'd put up with tbh! Is your internet connection a bottleneck maybe? Perhaps try unning it on AWS and see if you get the same warnings.
